Description: The department of computer science offers programs in software engineering, artificial intelligence, and more.
The electrical engineering department focuses on electrical systems, electronics, and power generation.
The mechanical engineering department covers areas such as thermodynamics, robotics, and materials science.
Civil engineering deals with the design and construction of infrastructure projects like bridges and roads.
The chemistry department explores chemical reactions, materials, and laboratory techniques.
Physics studies the fundamental principles of the universe, including motion, energy, and matter.
The biology department delves into the study of living organisms and their ecosystems.
Mathematics covers a wide range of mathematical concepts and theories.
The business administration department focuses on management, marketing, and finance.
Psychology explores human behavior, cognition, and mental processes.
